{"temporary":false,"message":"ROLE: Expert academic translator of Classical Islamic texts; prioritize accuracy and structure over fluency.
CRITICAL NEGATIONS: 1. NO SANITIZATION (Do not soften polemics). 2. NO META-TALK (Output translation only; no questions/offers to the user; no extra commentary). 3. NO MARKDOWN (Plain text only; no markup wrappers like *...*, _..._, `...`, $...$). 4. NO EMENDATION. 5. NO INFERENCE. 6. NO RESTRUCTURING. 7. NO OPAQUE TRANSLITERATION (Must translate phrases). 8. NO INVENTED SEGMENTS.
RULES: NO ARABIC SCRIPT (Except ﷺ). Plain text only. DEFINITION RULE: On first occurrence, transliterated technical terms (e.g., bidʿah) MUST be defined: "translit (English)". Preserve Segment ID. Translate meaning/intent. No inference. No extra fields. Parentheses: Allowed IF present in source OR for (a) technical definitions, (b) dates, (c) book codes.
ARABIC LEAK (Hard ban; highest priority over fidelity/quotes/term rules):
- SCRIPT LOCK: Output must be 100% Latin script (ASCII + ALA-LC diacritics like ā ī ū ḥ ṣ ḍ ṭ ẓ ʿ ʾ). These diacritics are allowed/required and are NOT Arabic script.
- STRICT BAN: Arabic script codepoints (letters, Arabic-Indic numerals ٠-٩, punctuation like ، ؟ ؛ , tatweel ـ, and Arabic presentation forms) are forbidden everywhere in output (even inside quotes/brackets/parentheses/citations), except ﷺ.
- NO QUOTE/CITATION COPY: Do NOT paste Arabic source text anywhere (quotes/citations/brackets/parentheses). Translate into English only.
- NO MIXED-SCRIPT: Never output a token that mixes Latin and Arabic characters (example: ʿĪد). Rewrite contaminated names/terms fully in Latin ALA-LC.
- ZERO ARABIC: Output must contain ZERO Arabic script characters (except ﷺ), including residue after Allah and Arabic-head glosses inside En...[TRUNCATED]

{"result":{"conversation":{"conversationId":"495b3f4a-b882-4ce6-b5c9-ee5d317c6d3b","title":"New conversation","starred":false,"createTime":"2026-02-18T18:07:57.870971Z","modifyTime":"2026-02-18T18:07:57.871822Z","systemPromptName":"","temporary":false,"mediaTypes":[],"workspaces":[],"taskResult":null}}}
{"result":{"response":{"userResponse":{"responseId":"f2bd497d-d19b-4a08-9453-58dcdaf9238e","message":"ROLE: Expert academic translator of Classical Islamic texts; prioritize accuracy and structure over fluency.
CRITICAL NEGATIONS: 1. NO SANITIZATION (Do not soften polemics). 2. NO META-TALK (Output translation only; no questions/offers to the user; no extra commentary). 3. NO MARKDOWN (Plain text only; no markup wrappers like *...*, _..._, `...`, $...$). 4. NO EMENDATION. 5. NO INFERENCE. 6. NO RESTRUCTURING. 7. NO OPAQUE TRANSLITERATION (Must translate phrases). 8. NO INVENTED SEGMENTS.
RULES: NO ARABIC SCRIPT (Except ﷺ). Plain text only. DEFINITION RULE: On first occurrence, transliterated technical terms (e.g., bidʿah) MUST be defined: "translit (English)". Preserve Segment ID. Translate meaning/intent. No inference. No extra fields. Parentheses: Allowed IF present in source OR for (a) technical definitions, (b) dates, (c) book codes.
ARABIC LEAK (Hard ban; highest priority over fidelity/quotes/term rules):
- SCRIPT LOCK: Output must be 100% Latin script (ASCII + ALA-LC diacritics like ā ī ū ḥ ṣ ḍ ṭ ẓ ʿ ʾ). These diacritics are allowed/required and are NOT Arabic script.
- STRICT BAN: Arabic script codepoints (letters, Arabic-Indic numerals ٠-٩, punctuation like ، ؟ ؛ , tatweel ـ, and Arabic presentation forms) are forbidden everywhere in output (even inside quotes/brackets/parentheses/citations), except ﷺ.
- NO QUOTE/CITATION COPY: Do NOT paste Arabic source text anywhere (quotes/citations/brackets/parentheses). Translate into English only.
- NO MIXED-SCRIPT: Never output a token that mixes Latin and Arabic characters (example: ʿĪد). Rewrite contaminated names/terms fully in Latin ALA-LC.
- ZERO ARABIC: Output must contain ZERO Arabic script characters (except ﷺ), including residue after Allah and Arabic-head glosses inside English clauses (single or multi-word; forbidden: Allah تعالى, حسن الظن بالله (good expectation of Allah), فضل (favor)). If any Arabic appears, rewrite the FULL Arabic span: names/technical terms -> Latin transliteration; all other spans -> English (if unsure, use English).
- HONORIFICS ANTI-LEAK: Never output Arabic honorific spellouts like "صلى الله عليه وسلم" or "صلى الله عليه وآله وسلم". Always replace any Prophet salutation with ﷺ.
WORD CHOICE (Allah vs god):
- If the source uses الله, output Allah (exact spelling: A-l-l-a-h; no diacritics). Never "God" / "god" / "Allāh". (This is the only exception to ALA-LC diacritics.)
- DO NOT convert Allah-based formulae into English “God …” idioms. Forbidden: any "God ..." rendering (any casing/punctuation), including common forms like God willing, By God, Praise be to God, God knows best, God forbid, O God, In the name of God, God Almighty, By God's grace, God's mercy.
- For the locked items listed under LOCKED FORMULAE below: you MUST output the locked transliteration exactly (no translation).
- For other phrases containing الله that are NOT in the locked list: translate normally, but the output must contain "Allah" (never "God").
- Use god/gods (lowercase) only for false gods/deities or when the Arabic uses إله/آلهة in a non-Allah sense.
- Do not “upgrade” god -> God unless the source is explicitly referring to a specific non-Islamic deity as a proper name.
LOCKED FORMULAE (Do NOT translate):
- These are common Muslim greetings/core invocations. Output them exactly as written below (Latin letters only + diacritics where shown).
- CHECK THIS LIST FIRST. If a phrase matches, output the transliteration EXACTLY in Latin script (no translation, no paraphrase, no Arabic script).
- These are the ONLY phrases allowed to remain as multi-word transliteration with NO English gloss.
- This exception overrides only the translation/gloss constraints below (it does NOT override SCRIPT LOCK):
- CRITICAL NEGATIONS #7: "NO OPAQUE TRANSLITERATION (Must translate phrases)."
- TRANSLITERATION & TERMS #2: "Do NOT output multi-word transliterations without immediate English translation."
- TRANSLITERATION & TERMS: "Do NOT transliterate full sentences/matn/quotes."
- Greetings: al-salāmu ʿalaykum; wa ʿalaykum al-salām
- Invocations: in shāʾ Allah; subḥān Allah; al-ḥamdu li-Allah; Allahu akbar; lā ilāha illā Allah ;
- DO NOT translate these into English. Forbidden English equivalents include (not exhaustive): "peace be upon you", "God willing", "praise be to God", "glory be to God", "Allah is Greatest".
- Note: this lock is intentionally narrow. Other phrases (e.g., "Jazāk Allahu khayr") may be translated normally.
REGISTER (Modern English):
- Use modern academic English.\...[TRUNCATED]

{"result":{"response":{"token":"<xai:tool_usage_card>
  <xai:tool_usage_card_id>c949753b-ca74-4699-a55f-4e32098aa259</xai:tool_usage_card_id>
  <xai:tool_name>chatroom_send</xai:tool_name>
  <xai:tool_args><![CDATA[{"message":"Here is the full accurate translation following all the specified rules for the segments. Output format strictly adhered to: ID - text, speakers labeled, line breaks preserved for turns, all Arabic translated or properly transliterated with definitions on first use, no Arabic script, locked phrases handled, polemics untranslated as is, etc.\n\nP101391 - The Shaykh: He said: \"and the ḥarbī (belligerent non-Muslim), the dhimmī (protected non-Muslim), and the mustaʾmin (one granted security) inherit from one another.\" These are three categories of the kuffār (disbelievers). The ḥarbī is the one between whom and us there is no covenant and no dhimmāh (protection pact) and no aman (security).\nThe second: and the mustaʾmin, and most of the people say it with fatḥah on the mīm: mustaʾman and this is a mistake because he is not mustaʾman but he is mustaʾmin with kasrah on the mīm and the mustaʾmin is the one who has been given aman that he not be assaulted whether from the Imām or from one whom the Imām permits to grant his protection as the Prophet ﷺ said: (We have granted protection to the one to whom you have granted protection, O Umm Hāniʾ).\nThe third: the dhimmī, the dhimmī is the one between whom and us there is a covenant and dhimmāh that he remain in our abode secure his rights preserved for him and he not be assaulted but upon him is the jizyah (compensatory tax).\nThere remains a fourth: the muʿāhid (treaty holder), the muʿāhid is the one between whom and the Muslims a covenant has occurred but he is in his land independent the Muslims have no attachment to it except the covenant between us and them these inherit from one another.\nThe author may Allah have mercy on him says \"some of them inherit from some of them\".\nThese inherit from one another if their religions agree all of them Jews all of them Christians all of them Magians all of them communists they inherit if their religions agree and if they differ? If they differ then no inheritance and the proof is his ﷺ saying: (The Muslim does not inherit the kāfir (disbeliever) and the kāfir does not inherit the Muslim) so this indicates that difference of religion is a preventer of inheritance and for this reason he said and the people of the dhimmāh inherit some of them from some of them with agreement of their religions not with difference of them. The people of the dhimmāh is it possible that their religions differ?\nQuestioner: Yes.\nThe Shaykh: Yes Jews Christians Magians these are the peopl...[TRUNCATED]

{"responses":[{"responseId":"5b128365-2fed-4339-a2b6-8a85a62ad182", "message":"P101391 - The Shaykh: He said: "and the ḥarbī (belligerent non-Muslim), the dhimmī (protected non-Muslim), and the mustaʾmin (one granted security) inherit from one another." These are three categories of the kuffār (disbelievers). The ḥarbī is the one between whom and us there is no covenant and no dhimmāh (protection pact) and no amān (security).
The second: and the mustaʾmin, and most of the people say it with fatḥah on the mīm: mustaʾman and this is a mistake because he is not mustaʾman but he is mustaʾmin with kasrah on the mīm and the mustaʾmin is the one who has been given amān that he not be assaulted whether from the Imām or from one whom the Imām permits to grant his protection as the Prophet ﷺ said: (We have granted protection to the one to whom you have granted protection, O Umm Hāniʾ).
The third: the dhimmī, the dhimmī is the one between whom and us there is a covenant and dhimmāh that he remain in our abode secure his rights preserved for him and he not be assaulted but upon him is the jizyah (compensatory tax).
There remains a fourth: the muʿāhid (treaty holder), the muʿāhid is the one between whom and the Muslims a covenant has occurred but he is in his land independent the Muslims have no attachment to it except the covenant between us and them these inherit from one another.
The author may Allah have mercy on him says "some of them inherit from some of them".
These inherit from one another if their religions agree all of them Jews all of them Christians all of them Magians all of them communists they inherit if their religions agree and if they differ? If they differ then no inheritance and the proof is his ﷺ saying: (The Muslim does not inherit the kāfir (disbeliever) and the kāfir does not inherit the Muslim) so this indicates that difference of religion is a preventer of inheritance and for this reason he said and the people of the dhimmāh inherit some of them from some of them with agreement of their religions not with difference of them. The people of the dhimmāh is it possible that their religions differ?
Questioner: Yes.
The Shaykh: Yes Jews Christians Magians these are the people of the dhimmāh three categories and the correct is that it is more than three categories that all the kuffār can be people of dhimmāh the jizyah is contracted for them as is authentic in what Muslim narrated from Buraydah may Allah be pleased with him.
He said: "and they are milal shattā (various religious communities)" they the pronoun returns to the people of the religions milal shattā disparate the Jews a millah (religious community) and the Christians a millah and the Magians a millah and the communists a millah and the Buddhists a millah and so on and this is the preponderant view.
And some of the scholars said that kufr (disbelief) is one millah but this view is weak because the Jews say the Christians are not upon anything and the Christians say the Jews are not upon anything so how can they be one ummah yes they with respect to Islām are one category but with respect to what is between them they are different as we say for example the people of the Sunnah includes the Muʿtazilah includes the Ashʿariyyah includes everyone who has not committed kufr from the people of bidʿah (innovation) if we say this in opposition to the Rāfiḍah but if we want to clarify the types of the people of the Sunnah we say that the people of the Sunnah in reality are the righteous Salaf who gathered upon the Sunnah and took it and then the Ashʿariyyah and the Muʿtazilah and the Jahmiyyah and their likes are not from the people of the Sunnah in this meaning "and they are milal shattā".

P101392 - The Shaykh: "and the murtadd (apostate) does not inherit anyone" because he and we seek refuge with Allah has no religion and is not confirmed upon his religion meaning if there was with us a kāfir atheist of utmost atheism do we confirm him upon his religion or not?
We confirm him upon his religion but if one apostatizes to Judaism or Christianity we do not confirm them due to the saying of the Prophet ﷺ (Whoever changes his religion then kill him) meaning the religion of Islām so we kill him so the murtadd does not inherit anyone and not his father?
Questioner: And not his father.
The Shaykh: And not his mother?
Questioner: And not his mother.
The Shaykh: And not his son?
Questioner: And not his son.
The Shaykh: And not his son a murtadd opposing the religion and not upon his religion because he is not confirmed upon this religion and if he dies upon his riddah (apostasy) then his wealth is fayʾ (reverted property) meaning it enters into the bayt al-māl (public treasury) if he dies upon his riddah then his wealth is fayʾ and here we know that the scholars may Allah have mercy on them rule upon the specific person with apostasy or other than it what his action necessitates contrary to some of the youth now who hesitate to dec...[TRUNCATED]
